support.description: Content is actively maintained. Please report errors and inconsistencies

author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is practicing for their own welfare, but not that of others.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attanā sīlasampanno hoti, no paraṃ sīlasampadāya samādapeti;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom. But they don’t encourage others in these qualities.

segments.pli: attanā samādhisampanno hoti, no paraṃ samādhisampadāya samādapeti;
attanā paññāsampanno hoti, no paraṃ paññāsampadāya samādapeti;
attanā vimuttisampanno hoti, no paraṃ vimuttisampadāya samādapeti;
attanā vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, no paraṃ vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadāya samādapeti.
Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāyā”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these five qualities is practicing for their own welfare, but not that of others.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is practicing for…

suttaplex.blurb: By practicing but not teaching, one practices for one’s own good.
